title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not identify the profit-maximizing quantity as 56 units and/or does not explain that at that quantity marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost.
The response identifies the profit-maximizing quantity as 56 units and explains that at that quantity marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the firm earns negative economic profit and/or does not explain that the firm’s average total cost curve is above the demand curve, or the firm charges a price that is less than the average total cost, or ATC > P. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGbbGaaeivai aaboeacaqGGaGaaeOpaiaabccacaqGqbGaaiOlaaaa@3EEB@

The response states that the firm earns negative economic profit and explains that the firm’s average total cost curve is above the demand curve, or the firm charges a price that is less than the average total cost, or ATC > P. title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate CompAce’s total revenue at the allocatively efficient quantity as $3,700 and/or does not show the work.

Total Revenue = Price×Quantity = $50×74 = $3,700 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaaa baaaaaaaaapeGaaeivaiaab+gacaqG0bGaaeyyaiaabYgacaqGGcGa aeOuaiaabwgacaqG2bGaaeyzaiaab6gacaqG1bGaaeyzaiaabckaca qG9aGaaeiOaiaabcfacaqGYbGaaeyAaiaabogacaqGLbGaey41aqRa aeyuaiaabwhacaqGHbGaaeOBaiaabshacaqGPbGaaeiDaiaabMhaca qGGcGaaeypaiaabckacaqGKaGaaeynaiaabcdacqGHxdaTcaqG3aGa aeinaiaabckacaqG9aGaaeiOaiaabscacaqGZaGaaeilaiaabEdaca qGWaGaaeimaaaa@6527@

The response calculates CompAce’s total revenue at the allocatively efficient quantity as $3,700 and shows the work.

Total Revenue = Price×Quantity = $50×74 = $3,700 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaaa baaaaaaaaapeGaaeivaiaab+gacaqG0bGaaeyyaiaabYgacaqGGcGa aeOuaiaabwgacaqG2bGaaeyzaiaab6gacaqG1bGaaeyzaiaabckaca qG9aGaaeiOaiaabcfacaqGYbGaaeyAaiaabogacaqGLbGaey41aqRa aeyuaiaabwhacaqGHbGaaeOBaiaabshacaqGPbGaaeiDaiaabMhaca qGGcGaaeypaiaabckacaqGKaGaaeynaiaabcdacqGHxdaTcaqG3aGa aeinaiaabckacaqG9aGaaeiOaiaabscacaqGZaGaaeilaiaabEdaca qGWaGaaeimaaaa@6527@

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that at that price ($60) the firm will continue to produce and not shut down in the short run and/or does not explain that the price is above the average variable cost which means the firm generates enough revenue to pay for its variable costs and some of its fixed costs, so the firm loses less by producing, in the short run, than shutting down and losing all of its fixed costs.

The response states that at that price ($60) the firm will continue to produce and not shut down in the short run and explains that the price is above the average variable cost which means the firm generates enough revenue to pay for its variable costs and some of its fixed costs, so the firm loses less by producing, in the short run, than shutting down and losing all of its fixed costs.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that yes, CompAce has a dominant strategy and/or does not explain that CompAce’s payoff is always higher when it lowers the price ( $3,000 > $2,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGKaGaae4mai aabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGGaGaaeOpaiaabccacaqGKaGa aeOmaiaabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdaaaa@434E@ and $4,000 > $1,800 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGKaGaaeinai aabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGGaGaaeOpaiaabccacaqGKaGa aeymaiaabYcacaqG4aGaaeimaiaabcdaaaa@4356@ ) regardless of whether ScanzAll chooses to advertise or not advertise; or explain that when ScanzAll chooses to not advertise, CompAce’s payoff is higher if it lowers its price ( $3,000 > $2,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGKaGaae4mai aabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGGaGaaeOpaiaabccacaqGKaGa aeOmaiaabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdaaaa@434E@ ), and when ScanzAll chooses to advertise, CompAce’s payoff is higher if it lowers the price ( $4,000 > 1,800 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGKaGaaeinai aabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGGaGaaeOpaiaabccacaqGXaGa aeilaiaabIdacaqGWaGaaeimaaaa@42AF@ ), which means that CompAce’s dominant strategy is to lower the price.

The response states that yes, CompAce has a dominant strategy and explains that CompAce’s payoff is always higher when it lowers the price ( $3,000 > $2,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGKaGaae4mai aabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGGaGaaeOpaiaabccacaqGKaGa aeOmaiaabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdaaaa@434E@ and $4,000 > $1,800 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGKaGaaeinai aabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGGaGaaeOpaiaabccacaqGKaGa aeymaiaabYcacaqG4aGaaeimaiaabcdaaaa@4356@ ) regardless of whether ScanzAll chooses to advertise or not advertise; or explains that when ScanzAll chooses to not advertise, CompAce’s payoff is higher if it lowers its price ( $3,000 > $2,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGKaGaae4mai aabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGGaGaaeOpaiaabccacaqGKaGa aeOmaiaabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdaaaa@434E@ ), and when ScanzAll chooses to advertise, CompAce’s payoff is higher if it lowers the price ( $4,000 > 1,800 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGKaGaaeinai aabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGGaGaaeOpaiaabccacaqGXaGa aeilaiaabIdacaqGWaGaaeimaaaa@42AF@ ), which means that CompAce’s dominant strategy is to lower the price.

title: Part G
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not identify Nash equilibrium as CompAce lowers its price and ScanzAll does not advertise ($3,000, $4,500) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGOaGaaeijai aabodacaqGSaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGWaGaaeilaiaabccacaqGKaGa aeinaiaabYcacaqG1aGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGPaaaaa@43F7@ , close parenthesis, and/or does not explain that if CompAce chooses to maintain its price, its payoff will decrease from $3,000 to $2,000, and if ScanzAll chooses to advertise, its payoff will decrease from $4,500 to $3,500; therefore, there is no incentive for either firm to change its strategy.

The response identifies Nash equilibrium as CompAce lowers its price and ScanzAll does not advertise ($3,000, $4,500) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGOaGaaeijai aabodacaqGSaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGWaGaaeilaiaabccacaqGKaGa aeinaiaabYcacaqG1aGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGPaaaaa@43F7@ , and explains that if CompAce chooses to maintain its price, its payoff will decrease from $3,000 to $2,000, and if ScanzAll chooses to advertise, its payoff will decrease from $4,500 to $3,500; therefore, there is no incentive for either firm to change its strategy.

title: Part H
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that no, this offer will not result in a Nash equilibrium with different strategies and/or does not explain that the Nash equilibrium strategies will still be for CompAce to lower its price and ScanzAll to not advertise ($3,000, $4,500) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGOaGaaeijai aabodacaqGSaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGWaGaaeilaiaabccacaqGKaGa aeinaiaabYcacaqG1aGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGPaaaaa@43F7@ because if CompAce chooses to maintain its price, its payoff will decrease from $3,000 to $2,600 ( =$2,000 + $600 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqG9aGaaeijai aabkdacaqGSaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGWaGaaeiiaiaabUcacaqGGaGa aeijaiaabAdacaqGWaGaaeimaaaa@429C@ ), and if ScanzAll chooses to advertise, its payoff will decrease from $4,500 to $3,500; therefore, there is no incentive for either firm to change its strategy. Or explain that with the offer CompAce’s dominant strategy will continue to be to lower the price because its payoff will always be higher ( $3,000> $2,600 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGKaGaae4mai aabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqG+aGaaeiiaiaabscacaqGYaGa aeilaiaabAdacaqGWaGaaeimaaaa@42B1@ and $4,000> $2,400 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGKaGaaeinai aabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqG+aGaaeiiaiaabscacaqGYaGa aeilaiaabsdacaqGWaGaaeimaaaa@42B0@ ) and since ScanzAll has no dominant strategy it is better off to not advertise ( $4,500 > $3,500 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGKaGaaeinai aabYcacaqG1aGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGGaGaaeOpaiaabccacaqGKaGa ae4maiaabYcacaqG1aGaaeimaiaabcdaaaa@435A@ ); therefore, there is no incentive for either firm to change its strategy.

The response states that no, this offer will not result in a Nash equilibrium with different strategies and explains that the Nash equilibrium strategies will still be for CompAce to lower its price and ScanzAll to not advertise ($3,000, $4,500) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGOaGaaeijai aabodacaqGSaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGWaGaaeilaiaabccacaqGKaGa aeinaiaabYcacaqG1aGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGPaaaaa@43F7@ because if CompAce chooses to maintain its price, its payoff will decrease from $3,000 to $2,600 ( =$2,000 + $600 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqG9aGaaeijai aabkdacaqGSaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGWaGaaeiiaiaabUcacaqGGaGa aeijaiaabAdacaqGWaGaaeimaaaa@429C@ ), and if ScanzAll chooses to advertise, its payoff will decrease from $4,500 to $3,500; therefore, there is no incentive for either firm to change its strategy.
